text:
Listenend to this podcast on way to work today. Tons of really great insights. Perhaps the one that struck me the hardest though was: Why is curiosity going to be such an important trait going forward? Because ai is really good (and getting better and better) at answering questions, but humans are always going to be better at asking questions. <http://a16z.com/2016/06/07/kevin-kelly-inevitable/|a16z.com/2016/06/07/kevin-kelly-inevitable/>
s

A follow-up insight is that, in the future, the most successful people will be the ones who can work _with_ ai. This will permeate almost all careers (architects, doctors, lawyers, etc.) If you have the time. I suggest giving the whole thing a listen.
I'd argue with any statement that humans will always be better at anything

Humans are emotional meat bags. They will be good at asking questions, but not as good at answering questions that take into account a data set or corpus larger than they can hold in their tiny brains and conflicts with their experience or presumptions

attachments.title: Space Tourism Posters
attachments.text: Fourteen space travel posters of colorful, exotic space settings are now available free for downloading and printing.
